org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.autonomous

Class ArmAndGrabberController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbs.bears.ftc.util.RobotSubsytemManager
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.autonomous.ArmAndGrabberController

  • public class ArmAndGrabberController
extends RobotSubsytemManager
    This class controls the Arm and Grabber on our robot.
    Author:
    Marc D Nichitiu

      Epsilon represents the amount of time that is necessary for calculating velocity.

      This is the boolean that states whether the claw is open or not.

      This is the proportional constant for the arm position controller.

      This is the proportional constant for the arm velocity controller.

      Constructor and Description
      ArmAndGrabberController(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap)
      This constructor initializes the arm and grabber by starting the position of the arm and closing the claw.

      • armMotor

        public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor armMotor
        This is the armMotor object.

      • EPSILON

        public static final int EPSILON
        Epsilon represents the amount of time that is necessary for calculating velocity.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kPp

        public final double kPp
        This is the proportional constant for the arm position controller.

      • kPv

        public final double kPv
        This is the proportional constant for the arm velocity controller.

      • vel

        protected double vel
        This is the velocity of the arm, updated by the function calculateV().

      • isClawOpen

        protected boolean isClawOpen
        This is the boolean that states whether the claw is open or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArmAndGrabberController

        public ArmAndGrabberController(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap)
        This constructor initializes the arm and grabber by starting the position of the arm and closing the claw.
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - the hardware map which supplies the information to initialize the arm motor and servo objects.

    • Method Detail

      • goToPosArm

        public void goToPosArm(int position,
                       boolean qOpenClaw)
        This function uses a velocity P controller to move the arm to a position that is in front of it.
        Parameters:
        position - the target position of the arm.
        qOpenClaw - a boolean that determines whether to open the claw at the end or not. Precondition: position must be larger than the arm's current position.

      • posController

        public void posController(int target)
        This method will set the armMotor to have a power that will compensate for a difference in position. If called in a loop, it will effectively act as a position P controller. Precondition: the target param can be any int between 0 and 450, though for best performance only use positions in the range of 400 to 200: in front of the robot up to ~45deg from the vertical.
        Parameters:
        target - the target position to hold the arm at.

      • getVel

        public double getVel()
        This method returns the velocity.
        Returns:
        the velocity of the arm.

      • posController

        public void posController(int target,
                          double numSecs)
        This is another position controller, but it is encapsulated inside a loop to hold for an amount of time. Preconditions: the target param can be any int between 0 and 450, though for best performance only use positions in the range of 400 to 200: in front of the robot up to ~45deg from the vertical.
        Parameters:
        target - the target position.
        numSecs - the amount of seconds to hold the position at.

      • calculateV

        public void calculateV()
        This method calculates velocity of the arm over a period of EPSILON. It stores the velocity in the vel variable.

      • posControllerNoWobble

        public void posControllerNoWobble(int target,
                                  double numSecs)
        This method holds the arm at a given position, however it is tuned for use without a wobble.
        Parameters:
        target - the target position to hold the arm at.
        numSecs - the number of seconds to hold the arm at.

      • posControllerNoWobble

        public void posControllerNoWobble(int target)
        This method holds the arm at a given position, however it is tuned for use without a wobble.
        Parameters:
        target - the target position to hold the arm at.

      • goToPosArmBack

        public void goToPosArmBack(int position)
        Deprecated. This method should not be used.
        This method moves the arm to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to which the arm will move back to.

      • veloController

        public void veloController(int targetVel)
        Similar to the posController method with only one parameter, this method sets the motor power to a power that will compensate for a difference in measured and target velocity using a P controller.
        Parameters:
        targetVel - the target velocity of the velocity controller.

      • openClaw

        public void openClaw()
        This method opens the claw. It does not matter where the claw is.

      • closeClaw

        public void closeClaw()
        This method closes the claw. It does not matter where the claw is.

      • toggleClaw

        public void toggleClaw()
        This method toggles the claw's state: it opens the claw if it is closed, and vice versa.

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Specified by:
        shutDown in class RobotSubsytemManager
